Description:

Kangoo Jumps is one of the latest fitness crazes catching on across the country.  It's an amazing workout for people who are interested in losing weight and building strength.  

Kangoo is great for beginners and athletes alike due to its use of plyometric explosive techniques,  Basic moves are easy to follow and can be performed with growing complexity and intensity as you progress. Kangoo workouts maximize  cardio intensity, while minimizing the impact to the joints.

Join our club to find out more about indoor fitness classes, outdoor boot camps or just to connect with other Kangoo enthusiasts from your area!   

Meetup members can now rent their Kangoo boots and take class for $15.00 per class!!! No obligation to join.  

33 Benefits of Kangoo Jumps, by Dr. Morton Walker and Albert E. Carter

1.  It provides an increased G-force (gravitational load), which strengthens the musculoskeletal systems. 

2.  It protects the joints from the chronic fatigue delivered by exercising on hard surfaces. 

3.  It helps manage body composition and improves muscle-to-fat ratio. 

4.  It increases capacity for respiration. 

5.  It circulates more oxygen to the tissues. 

6.  It establishes a better equilibrium between the oxygen required by the tissues and the oxygen made available. 

7.  It aids lymphatic circulation by stimulating the millions of one-way valves in the lymphatic system. 

8.  It tends to reduce the height to which the arterial pressures rise during exertion. 

9.  It lessens the time during which blood pressure remains abnormal after severe activity. 

10.  It assists in the rehabilitation of a heart problem. 

11.  It increases the functional activity of the red bone marrow in the production of red blood cells. 

12.  It improves resting metabolic rate so that more calories are burned for hours after exercise. 

13.  It causes muscles to perform work in moving fluids through the body to lighten the heart's load. 

14.  It decreases the volume of blood pooling in the veins of the cardiovascular system preventing chronic edema. 

15.  It encourages collateral circulation by increasing the capillary count in the muscles and decreasing the distance between the capillaries and the target cells. 

16.  It strengthens the heart and other muscles in the body so that they work more efficiently. 

17.  It allows the resting heart to beat less often. 

18.  It lowers circulating cholesterol and triglyceride levels. 

19.  It lowers low-density lipoprotein (bad) and increases high-density lipoprotein (good) within the blood holding off the incidence of coronary artery disease. 

20.  It promotes tissue repair. 

21.  It increases the mitochondria count within the muscle cells, essential for endurance. 

22.  It adds to the alkaline reserve of the body, which may be of significance in an emergency requiring prolonged effort. 

23.  It improves coordination between the propreoceptors in the joints, the transmission of nerve impulses to and from the brain, transmission of nerve impulses and responsiveness of the muscle fibers. 

24.  It improves the brain's responsiveness to the vestibular apparatus within the inner ear, thus improving balance. 

25.  It offers relief from neck and back pains, headaches, and other pain caused by lack of exercise. 

26.  It enhances digestion and elimination processes. 

27.  It allows for deeper and easier relaxation and sleep. 

28.  It results in better mental performance, with keener learning processes. 

29.  It curtails fatigue and menstrual discomfort for women. 

30.  It minimizes the number of colds, allergies, digestive disturbances, and abdominal problems. 

31.  It tends to slow down atrophy in the aging process. 

32.  It is an effective modality by which the user gains a sense of control and an improved self-image. 

33.  It is enjoyable! 

For more information about the 33 Benefits, refer to the following books:

Dear Friends, Basketball has provided many of us with fond childhood memories of playing outside with our friends. Imagine not having these activities available as a child. The WorldVentures Foundation, in partnership with phenomenal Coach and Basketball Hall of Famer Nancy Lieberman, created the DreamCourts™ program to serve children. With the support of local individuals and businesses, we have built high-quality basketball courts throughout the United States at Boys & Girls Clubs of America. This initiative makes a difference in the lives of your local children, inspiring communities to promote joy and support local youth. DreamCourts are a multi-sport play space designed to promote physical fitness and fun. The goal of the program is to help keep children off the streets and to provide them with a safe and competitive environment where they can develop skills, such as teamwork and good sportsmanship. Since 2010, we have built 20 DreamCourts and impacted hundreds of lives in communities just like yours. Today, we are asking for your financial support toward the building of more DreamCourts. Your donation is tax deductible* and every dollar directly funds the construction of DreamCourts. We invite your questions.

VISIT https://impact.wvfoundation.org/fundraise?fcid=451400 FOR MORE INFO

Hello, and welcome!

This group is for anyone who has solo work to do and would like to have a structured time and place in which (and company with which) to do it. I'm thinking folks who own their own businesses or work from home, students, writers, teachers with lessons to plan or mountains of grading, you get the picture.

My time is currently very unstructured, and I find it easy to procrastinate desk work. I have several items/projects to accomplish, and decided to start setting aside some time for it, and invite others to join as well.

Please feel free to suggest times and places, and always feel free to suggest or create events yourself if a few of you would like to meet at times other than those I have planned.

------------

While this is currently just a "get together and do work" kind of thing, I am toying with the idea of creating separate events for folks who are interested in some kind of goal-sharing group. I'm thinking something like a weekly or bi-weekly meeting where folks can share goals they have (career, personal, fitness, diet, anything - it's your goal) and how they are doing with them. This doesn't need to be some heavy deal - no one holding anyone else's feet to the fire, no daily check-ins, everyone is responsible for themselves. But I know that just having the structure of stating my goals and knowing that I will be sharing my progress at semi-regular intervals helps keep me on track.

If you have any interest in this, please let me know.

results.description: Dedham Square Coffeehouse hosts Stump Team Trivia every Wednesday night begining June 1st at 7:30 PM. All ages, free admission, serving beer, wine and our full menu. Gift certificates will be awarded to the top two teams. Note: Gift certificates will not be reedeamable on the night they are awarded. Founded in 1999 outside of Boston MA, Stump! Trivia Quiz is a live hosted knowledge based event played in bars and restaurants all over the country. We currently conduct approximately 400 events a week, providing fun and exciting competitions in bars, restaurants and special events. Get your team, (up to 6 max) to one of our venues to test your skill at an assortment of trivia questions, from Anatomy to Literature, Movies to History, Sports to Science. Other trivia companies, players, bar owners always ask: What has made Stump! Trivia so successful since 1999? The Format, the Hosts and the Questions. 1) FORMAT…Our unique format makes the game more exciting than most. We combine the strategy of wagering points, with the need for cleverness for our bonus rounds.This is not just 50, 60, or 70 questions asked in a row and whoever has the highest score wins. Stump! involves strategy, which helps keep new teams winning each week. 2) HOSTS…Our staff of professionally trained hosts. These are not Dj’s, but people that love trivia, love running trivia events. They realize that Stump! is the entertainment and their job is to complement it. Being able to keep the pace of the game, recruit first time teams, or help someone with the clarity of a question, these men and women know what they are doing. Over 50% of our hosts have been with Stump for 5+ years, 25% 10+ years. Our hosts run the spectrum of jobs, from Teachers, lawyers, bio-chemists, fishermen, private eyes, and even a couple cool Accountants. Our hosts help seperate Stump! from the rest of the field. Check out what some of our hosts do on their biopage. 3) QUESTIONS… Since our founding in 1999, our focus has been on the question writing. In order to gain any respect from trivia players, the content needs to be 100% correct. You can have the best format, the best hosts, but if the questions you ask are wrong, you are in the WRONG business. How long would you be in the restaurant business if your food is awful. Although we get ideas from people all across the country, we create all original content. As far as we know there has not been a wrong question since August 8th 2012, and this was the question. (BTW, It wasn’t wrong, it just had a second answer that we didn’t realize). In Mythology, what famous creature was the offspring of Poseiden and the snake-haired Medusa, born from her neck when Perseus beheaded her? 1) Pegasus (The “Famous” winged Horse that most people have heard of, that was our answer.) And the answer that one team brought up 2) Chrysaor was a son of the Gorgon Medusa. He was usually represented as giant, but may also have been conceived of as a winged boar, just as his twin brother Pegasus was a winged horse. .
results.name: Stump Team Trivia at Dedham Square Coffeehouse

results.description:
We play Tak. 
We talk about Tak. 
We teach each other how to play Tak better. 

New to Tak? Just curious? 

Tak is a new abstract strategy game created by James Ernest and Patrick Rothfuss. It is in the same family as chess, go, and mancala...a beautiful game with simple rules and deep strategy.

How to play: https://youtu.be/iEXkpS-Q9dI

Most of the people you find here are ones who participated in the Tak Kickstarter Campaign (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/cheapassgames/tak-a-beautiful-game) which is probably the best place to find links to getting your hands on the game itself...but you can always come play with us, as we have built multiple sets and by the fall the Official Sets will be available as well.

In the meantime, why not join in our games as we meet in the Natick, MA and Boston areas?

We look forward to seeing you.

results.description:
Welcome to the Boston Bayesians meetup group.

We are a small group of data scientists, statisticians, engineers and entrepreneurs interested in the practical applications of Bayesian statistics. Join us for friendly academic briefings, stories from real-world projects, and open discussion of Bayesian inference, tools, techniques and case studies.

We follow a conventional format of 1 or 2 presentations from volunteers in the group and/or invited experts, and general conversation and socialising afterwards. Think of us as your Bayesian self-help group in the Boston Area.

Some topics of interest are: 

- Bayesian Data Analysis.
- Probabilistic programming with PyMC and STAN.
- Model checking techniques.
- Monte Carlo methods for Bayesian Inference.
- Real-world examples of hierarchical models.
- Bayesian Machine Learning.
- Bayesian Reinforcement Learning.
- Non-linear and non-parametric models. 

Call for presentations: 

We provide a supporting environment to share your ideas and get feedback on your work. If you are interested in presenting, please submit presentation proposals at BostonBayesians@gmail.com.

First Meetup:

We are planning our first meetup for late-June/Early-July 2016. Stay tuned for more details.

Follow us on Twitter: @BostonBayesians
results.name: Boston Bayesians

results.description:
This group is for those who want to Do Awesome by volunteering time and energy to people and causes which could use a little bit of extra help in the world. The benefits of volunteering are enormous to you, your family, and the world. It offers you the opportunity to connect to your community and to organizations where helping out with the smallest tasks can make a real difference to the lives of people, animals, and groups in need. 

Our volunteering events will primarily take place outside of Boston. If you prefer events in the city, we highly recommend excellent groups such as Boston Volunteers and Single Volunteers Boston. We have no age restrictions and families are welcome to join the group. Some opportunities may require preregistration with an outside organization or may have certain restrictions based on the venue or nature of the help that is needed. This could include background checks or specific physical abilities. Details will be provided as needed. 

We expect all participants to be thoughtful, respectful, and to act appropriately at all times. This includes:\

• Following through with the commitment to serve when you sign up for an event. "No Shows" will not be tolerated. 

• No conduct endangering the life, safety, health or well-being of others. 

• Properly managing the behavior of any children or guests that attend an event with you. You will be held responsible for their actions. 

• Maintaining the confidentiality and privacy of any group member, organization, or person involved in our events. 

• No attacking the political, cultural, or religious beliefs of others. Instead, suggest an event that will support the causes that you care about. 

Signing up, showing up, and acting responsibly is all that is asked of you. Telling us about volunteering opportunities, offering to host events, and requests to be an organizer are always welcome.

Join now, check the calendar, and get ready to Do Awesome.
results.name: Do Awesome

results.description:
Hello Super Moms!

This Meetup is for Super Moms on Boston’s North Shore who are looking to find success where it matters most to them while making an incredible difference in their careers, communities and in the world.

Whether this difference is getting out the door on time (and with less stress!), showing up to work as the leader you are, speaking up when it is important, or starting something extraordinary, we all have such an opportunity to push through the doubt and beliefs that may be holding us back from making an impact where it matters most to us.

And when is there a better time to be present, motivated, determined and strong than right now when we can positively influence our children!

This Meetup is for you if you are looking to:

• Overcome burnout and find balance as a super working mom

• Improve time management

• More easily influence others as a confident leader

• Increase your energy and feel less scattered overall

• Invite more creativity into your life

• Stop being reactive to those around you and respond with confidence

• Connect with a community of moms who share your experiences and goals

This Meetup has been created to bring super moms on the north shore together to create connections and help each other find our voices, meet our goals and make a difference in our careers, communities and beyond. We will cover varying topics of professional and self-development, learn different skills and of course, have fun!

Who Should Join?

This Meetup is for all moms of children all ages, moms to be, future moms who are managing multiple things in their lives and have a strong desire to succeed and make a difference. If you can relate to this Meetup Group and would like to connect with other Super Moms, we welcome you.

results.description:
Firewalk Boston is a unique opportunity to bring people together who are ready to level up in their personal, professional, financial, personal or spiritual lives.  During this meetup we'll learn how changing what we think can change how we feel, behave and live our lives.  Firewalkers create long-standing relationships with one another. We hold one another accountable for attaining the goals we set during our initial firewalk!  We'll continue to meet--on a voluntary basis--to check in with one another after our Firewalk on June 25.

Firewalking promises to propel you past your obstacles, help you overcome self-limiting beliefs and negative patterns.  An ancient art once reserved for shamans and mystics, this practice is now available so everyone may benefit from its extreme transformational power.  Through a variety of activities, you'll learn to identify the self-limiting beliefs holding you back from the life you envision. Faced with the powerful metaphor of walking across hot coals, you'll learn how to recognize fear and step past it into the way you'd like to be instead. For some, Firewalking is a deeply spiritual experience. For others, it is a motivational process unlike any other. 

Requirements for participation:  You must be 18 years old or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian who is participating and who will sign for you.  Please, no drugs or alcohol prior to or at the event as you'll need to pay 100% attention to do this!  We recommend wearing light colored, weather appropriate clothing with shoes that are easy to slip in and out of.  While we hope you will choose to firewalk, it is never required of you and your choice NOT to walk will be completely respected. For some, choosing not to walk is as empowering as walking!  
We encourage you to have your dinner meal prior to the event. We'll provide water and some light snacks (granola bars, nuts, fruit) for quick nutrition.

Join the thousands of people who've earned the right to call themselves Firewalkers!  One you walk on fire, you'll be certain you can do anything you set your mind to!  We look forward to meeting you at Firewalk Boston and following through with you in the Firewalking tribe!
results.name: FIREWALK BOSTON!

WOMEN OF ALL AGES

EMPOWERMENT ~ SUPPORT ~ COMMUNITY

Renew and replenish, build skills, create supportive community, and nourish your soul. Learn easy, practical techniques to restore balance to your life. Imagine a sanctuary where who you are, how you feel, and what you long for and vision is held, honored, and nurtured. A place where you are embraced and nourished in a collective healing vessel where self-judgment, doubt and fear are invited to gently come forward and transform in an alchemical vessel of trust, kindness, and love.
Join us to:
